description: Comprehensive M365 settings catalog for NIST 800-171 Rev 3 compliance - Batch 1

settings.description: Specifies maximum time (minutes) of inactivity before device automatically locks. Users can select shorter timeouts. Enforces automatic device lock after inactivity.
settings.implementationGuide:
1. Sign in to Intune admin center
2. Devices > Windows > Configuration profiles > Create
3. Platform: Windows 10+, Profile: Settings catalog
4. Add settings > Device Lock > Max Inactivity Time Device Lock
5. Set Device Password Enabled: true, Max time: 15 min
6. Assign to device groups
7. Deploy (requires device restart)

controlMappings.mappingRationale: Directly enforces NIST 03.01.10(a) - initiate device lock after organization-defined inactivity period. Primary Windows setting for automatic lock.
controlMappings.nistRequirement: Prevent access to the system by initiating a device lock after organization-defined time period of inactivity

settings.description: Alternative Windows setting - max time (seconds) before screen saver activates and locks session. 900 sec = 15 min. Works with screen saver settings.
settings.implementationGuide:
1. Intune admin center
2. Endpoint security > Attack surface reduction
3. Platform: Windows 10+, Profile: Security Baseline
4. Configuration > Local Policies Security Options
5. Interactive Logon: Machine inactivity limit = 900 seconds
6. Assign and deploy

controlMappings.mappingRationale: Alternative GPO-equivalent method for device lock after inactivity. Use either this OR MaxInactivityTimeDeviceLock, not both (can conflict).
controlMappings.nistRequirement: Prevent access to the system by initiating a device lock after organization-defined time period of inactivity

settings.description: Idle time (seconds) before screen saver activates. 1-86400 sec range. USER-level policy. Works with machine inactivity limit.
settings.implementationGuide:
1. Devices > Windows > Configuration > Create
2. Platform: Windows 10+, Profile: Settings catalog
3. Add settings > Administrative Templates > Control Panel > Personalization
4. Screen saver timeout (User): Enabled, 900 seconds
5. Assign to user/device groups

controlMappings.mappingRationale: Supplementary setting - screen saver timeout works with password protection to enforce locking. Not primary method but supports NIST 03.01.10(a).
controlMappings.nistRequirement: Prevent access to the system by initiating a device lock after organization-defined time period of inactivity

settings.description: Enforces password when dismissing screen saver. REQUIRED if using screen saver-based locking. Ensures re-authentication per NIST 03.01.10(b).
settings.implementationGuide:
1. Devices > Windows > Configuration > Settings catalog
2. Add settings > Administrative Templates > Control Panel > Personalization
3. Password protect the screen saver (User): Enabled
4. Must combine with screen saver timeout
5. Assign and deploy

controlMappings.mappingRationale: CRITICAL for NIST 03.01.10(b) if using screen saver method. Without this, screen saver can be dismissed without authentication, violating requirement.
controlMappings.nistRequirement: Retain the device lock until the user reestablishes access using established identification and authentication procedures

settings.description: URL to JPG/PNG for Windows lock screen wallpaper. Locked, users cannot change. Conceals sensitive info per NIST 03.01.10(c). Enterprise/Education ONLY.
settings.implementationGuide:
1. Upload image to SharePoint/Azure Blob/OneDrive
2. Get public URL
3. Devices > Windows > Configuration > Device restrictions
4. Personalization > Locked screen picture URL: [image URL]
5. Assign to Enterprise/Education devices only
6. Users cannot change lock screen when set

controlMappings.mappingRationale: Satisfies NIST 03.01.10(c) - conceal info with publicly viewable image. Corporate image ensures consistent concealment of sensitive data on lock screen.
controlMappings.nistRequirement: Conceal, via the device lock, information previously visible on the display with a publicly viewable image

settings.displayName: Prevent Users from Changing Lock Screen (Windows)
settings.description: Prevents users from changing lock screen background. Enforces NIST 03.01.10(c) by maintaining organizational control over lock screen content.
settings.implementationGuide:
1. Devices > Windows > Configuration > Settings catalog
2. Add settings > Administrative Templates > Control Panel > Personalization
3. Prevent changing lock screen and logon image: Enabled
4. Combine with LockScreenImageUrl policy
5. Settings grayed out for users

controlMappings.mappingRationale: Supports NIST 03.01.10(c) by preventing users from changing corporate lock screen. Ensures consistent information concealment compliance.
controlMappings.nistRequirement: Conceal, via the device lock, information previously visible on the display with a publicly viewable image

settings.description: Allows Windows Hello biometric authentication (face/fingerprint) as PIN alternative. Users must configure PIN as fallback. Enhances NIST 03.01.10(b) strong authentication.
settings.implementationGuide:
1. Endpoint security > Account protection > Create Policy
2. Platform: Windows 10+, Profile: Account protection
3. Use Windows Hello for Business: Enable
4. Use biometrics: Enable
5. Use enhanced anti-spoofing: Enable
6. Minimum PIN length: 6
7. Assign to device/user groups

controlMappings.mappingRationale: Supports NIST 03.01.10(b) with robust biometric authentication for reestablishing access after lock. Hardware-backed cryptographic keys provide stronger auth than passwords.
controlMappings.nistRequirement: Retain the device lock until the user reestablishes access using established identification and authentication procedures

settings.description: Minimum Windows Hello PIN length. Range: 4-127. Recommended: 6+. Ensures strong authentication for device unlock per NIST 03.01.10(b).
settings.implementationGuide:
1. Endpoint security > Account protection policy
2. Platform: Windows 10+, Profile: Account protection
3. Minimum PIN length: 6
4. Optional: Configure lowercase/uppercase/special char requirements
5. PIN expiration (days) if needed
6. Assign and deploy

controlMappings.mappingRationale: Essential for NIST 03.01.10(b) - ensures authentication procedures meet minimum strength. 6-digit PIN aligns with NIST SP 800-63B guidance.
controlMappings.nistRequirement: Retain the device lock until the user reestablishes access using established identification and authentication procedures

settings.displayName: Maximum Minutes of Inactivity Until Screen Locks (iOS)
settings.description: Max idle time (minutes) before iOS screen locks. Options: 1-15 min. Recommended: 5 min for NIST compliance. Prevents unauthorized access to unattended devices.
settings.implementationGuide:
1. Devices > iOS/iPadOS > Configuration > Create
2. Platform: iOS/iPadOS, Profile: Device restrictions
3. Password section > Maximum minutes of inactivity until screen locks: 5 minutes
4. Assign to user/device groups
5. Users can select any value up to maximum
6. Verify: Settings > Display & Brightness > Auto-Lock

controlMappings.mappingRationale: Directly enforces NIST 03.01.10(a) for iOS by auto-locking after inactivity. CIS Benchmark recommends 5 min or less.
controlMappings.nistRequirement: Prevent access to the system by initiating a device lock after organization-defined time period of inactivity

settings.displayName: Maximum Grace Period for Password After Screen Lock (iOS)
settings.description: Time (minutes) before password required after screen lock. 0 = Immediately. CRITICAL: Enforces NIST 03.01.10(b) - no grace period for unlock.
settings.implementationGuide:
1. Devices > iOS/iPadOS > Configuration > Device restrictions
2. Password section > Maximum minutes after screen lock before password required: Immediately (0)
3. Assign to groups
4. Verify: Settings > Touch ID & Passcode > Require Passcode: Immediately
5. Users cannot change this when managed

controlMappings.mappingRationale: CRITICAL for NIST 03.01.10(b) - ensures device lock retained until user re-authenticates. Setting to 0 prevents any grace period where device unlocks without auth.
controlMappings.nistRequirement: Retain the device lock until the user reestablishes access using established identification and authentication procedures

settings.description: Custom message on iOS lock screen. Satisfies NIST 03.01.10(c) for publicly viewable info. Requires supervised devices (ABM/ASM + ADE).
settings.implementationGuide:
1. Prerequisites: Supervised devices via Apple Business Manager
2. Devices > iOS/iPadOS > Configuration > Settings catalog
3. Add settings > System Configuration > Lock Screen Message > Lock Screen Footnote
4. Enter message (max ~100 chars recommended)
5. Assign to supervised device groups only
6. Appears at bottom of lock screen

controlMappings.mappingRationale: Supports NIST 03.01.10(c) by providing publicly viewable info on locked iOS devices. Shows ownership/contact while concealing sensitive content. Supervised devices only.
controlMappings.nistRequirement: Conceal, via the device lock, information previously visible on the display with a publicly viewable image

settings.displayName: Maximum Minutes of Inactivity Until Screen Locks (Android)
settings.description: Time (minutes) before Android screen locks. Applies to Android Enterprise fully managed/corporate-owned work profile. Recommended: 5 min for NIST.
settings.implementationGuide:
1. Devices > Android > Configuration > Create
2. Platform: Android Enterprise, Profile: Device restrictions (Fully managed/corporate-owned work profile)
3. Password section > Maximum minutes of inactivity until screen locks: 5
4. Assign to Android Enterprise device groups
5. Verify: Settings > Display > Screen timeout
6. Users cannot exceed maximum

controlMappings.mappingRationale: Directly enforces NIST 03.01.10(a) for Android Enterprise devices. CIS Android Benchmark recommends 1-5 min for security.
controlMappings.nistRequirement: Prevent access to the system by initiating a device lock after organization-defined time period of inactivity

settings.description: Custom text on Android lock screen. Supports device tokens {{deviceName}}, {{serialNumber}}. Max 4096 chars, recommend <200. Satisfies NIST 03.01.10(c).
settings.implementationGuide:
1. Devices > Android > Configuration > Device restrictions
2. Device password section > Lock screen message
3. Enter message (use device tokens if desired)
4. Auto-translates to device language
5. Assign to Android Enterprise corporate devices
6. Message appears before unlock

controlMappings.mappingRationale: Supports NIST 03.01.10(c) with publicly viewable info on locked Android devices. Displays ownership/contact while concealing sensitive data.
controlMappings.nistRequirement: Conceal, via the device lock, information previously visible on the display with a publicly viewable image
